trans-unit.source: Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials
trans-unit.target: Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials

trans-unit.source: Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials
trans-unit.target: Service to Service Calls Using Client Credentials

trans-unit.source: The OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant Flow permits a web service (a <newTerm>confidential client</newTerm>) to use its own credentials to authenticate when calling another web service, instead of impersonating a user.
trans-unit.target: The OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant Flow permits a web service (a <newTerm>confidential client</newTerm>) to use its own credentials to authenticate when calling another web service, instead of impersonating a user.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, the client is typically a middle-tier web service, a daemon service, or web site.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, the client is typically a middle-tier web service, a daemon service, or web site.

trans-unit.source: Client Credentials Grant Flow Diagram
trans-unit.target: Client Credentials Grant Flow Diagram

trans-unit.source: The following diagram explains how the Client Credentials Grant flow works in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram explains how the Client Credentials Grant flow works in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: The client application authenticates to the Azure AD token issuance endpoint and requests an access token.
trans-unit.target: The client application authenticates to the Azure AD token issuance endpoint and requests an access token.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD token issuance endpoint issues the access token.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD token issuance endpoint issues the access token.

trans-unit.source: The access token is used to authenticate to the secured resource.
trans-unit.target: The access token is used to authenticate to the secured resource.

trans-unit.source: Data from the secured resource is returned to the web application.
trans-unit.target: Data from the secured resource is returned to the web application.

trans-unit.source: Register the Services in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Register the Services in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Register both the calling service and the receiving service in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
trans-unit.target: Register both the calling service and the receiving service in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>Adding, Updating, and Removing an App</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=391831</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>Adding, Updating, and Removing an App</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=391831</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Request an Access Token
trans-unit.target: Request an Access Token

trans-unit.source: To request an access token, use an HTTP POST to the tenant-specific Azure AD endpoint.
trans-unit.target: To request an access token, use an HTTP POST to the tenant-specific Azure AD endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Service-to-Service Access Token Request
trans-unit.target: Service-to-Service Access Token Request

trans-unit.source: A service-to-service access token request contains the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: A service-to-service access token request contains the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: All parameters are required.
trans-unit.target: All parameters are required.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: response_type
trans-unit.target: response_type

trans-unit.source: [Required] Specifies the requested response type.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Specifies the requested response type.

trans-unit.source: In a Client Credentials Grant flow, the value must be <system>client_credentials</system>.
trans-unit.target: In a Client Credentials Grant flow, the value must be <system>client_credentials</system>.

trans-unit.source: client_id
trans-unit.target: client_id

trans-unit.source: [Required] Specifies the Azure AD client id of the calling web service.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Specifies the Azure AD client id of the calling web service.

trans-unit.source: To find the calling application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the calling application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: client_secret
trans-unit.target: client_secret

trans-unit.source: [Required] Enter a key registered for the calling web service in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Enter a key registered for the calling web service in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: To create a key, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To create a key, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: [Required] Enter the App ID URI of the receiving web service.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Enter the App ID URI of the receiving web service.

trans-unit.source: To find the App ID URI, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the App ID URI, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following HTTP POST requests an access token for the https://service.contoso.com/ web service.
trans-unit.target: The following HTTP POST requests an access token for the https://service.contoso.com/ web service.

trans-unit.source: The client_id identifies the web service that requests the access token.
trans-unit.target: The client_id identifies the web service that requests the access token.

trans-unit.source: Service-to-Service Access Token Response
trans-unit.target: Service-to-Service Access Token Response

trans-unit.source: A success response contains a JSON OAuth 2.0 response with the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: A success response contains a JSON OAuth 2.0 response with the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: access_token
trans-unit.target: access_token

trans-unit.source: The requested access token.
trans-unit.target: The requested access token.

trans-unit.source: The calling web service can use this token to authenticate to the receiving web service.
trans-unit.target: The calling web service can use this token to authenticate to the receiving web service.

trans-unit.source: access_type
trans-unit.target: access_type

trans-unit.source: Indicates the token type value.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the token type value.

trans-unit.source: The only type that Azure AD supports is <system>Bearer</system> For more information about bearer tokens, see <externalLink><linkText>The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework: Bearer Token Usage (RFC 6750).</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6750.txt</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: The only type that Azure AD supports is <system>Bearer</system> For more information about bearer tokens, see <externalLink><linkText>The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework: Bearer Token Usage (RFC 6750).</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6750.txt</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: expires_in
trans-unit.target: expires_in

trans-unit.source: How long the access token is valid (in seconds).
trans-unit.target: How long the access token is valid (in seconds).

trans-unit.source: expires_on
trans-unit.target: expires_on

trans-unit.source: The time when the access token expires.
trans-unit.target: The time when the access token expires.

trans-unit.source: The date is represented as the number of seconds from
trans-unit.target: The date is represented as the number of seconds from

trans-unit.source: 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.
trans-unit.target: 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.

trans-unit.source: This value is used to determine the lifetime of cached tokens.
trans-unit.target: This value is used to determine the lifetime of cached tokens.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: The App ID URI of the receiving web service.
trans-unit.target: The App ID URI of the receiving web service.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a success response to a request for an access token to a web service.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a success response to a request for an access token to a web service.
